message.content: This question requires a basic understanding of the effects of freezing rain on different materials. When rain freezes in the mountains, it can cause the water to expand and create cracks in rocks, such as granite. Option (B) is incorrect because trees are not directly affected by freezing rain in the same way rocks are. Option (C) is incorrect because bears are living organisms and not affected by freezing rain in this manner. Option (D) is incorrect because cars are man-made objects and not affected by freezing rain in the same way rocks are.

When rain freezes in the mountains, it can cause the water to expand, which can lead to the splitting of rocks and granite. Option (C) is incorrect because bears are living organisms and freezing rain would not cause them to split. Option (D) is incorrect because cars are made of materials like metal and plastic, which would not split from freezing rain.
